result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin R Morawski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery-Elderly, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any other sentence, with credit for 67 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.

No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No contact with the victim named in the complaint.

Mental health until supervision.
Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department. Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt: Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, for review. jbs
DENYING MOTION FOR SENTENCE MODIFICATION signed and filed
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  mag
Defendant's pro se motion for sentence modification (i.e. vacate DNA surcharge).

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6 YEARS with 67 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- Mental health unit supervision.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with the victim named in the complaint.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution set at zero; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Letter from Defendant to Victim

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Kevin R Morawski in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Kevin R Morawski in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Kevin R Morawski not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Plea/sentencing hearing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Kevin R Morawski not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin R Morawski in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Kevin R Morawski in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Joel Bunkelman-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RICHARD M., GIANNA M. AND PATRICK M.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING AND ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Kevin R Morawski in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  Defendant Kevin R Morawski in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
